thread.title: Will Devon MP Geoffrey Cox keep his job amid Brexit row - live updates - Devon Live

author: Joel Cooper
title: Will Devon MP Geoffrey Cox keep his job amid Brexit row - live updates - Devon Live
text:
Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
A vote will take place in parliament today in a row over the legal advice on Brexit issued by a Devon MP.
The Attorney General Geofrrey Cox, who is MP for Torridge and West Devon, will face a vote to decide whether they are in contempt of Parliament - along with the rest of Theresa May's government.
Sanctions for contempt include suspension, fines and possible imprisonment. Read More Contempt of Parliament vote could see Devon MP Geoffrey Cox suspended
Mr Cox hit the headlines earlier this week after delivering a theatrical performance in the House of Commons when he outlined the legal position on Theresa May 's Brexit deal. Attorney General Geoffrey Cox delivers a speech at the Conservative Party annual conference at the International Convention Centre, Birmingham.
However, he was criticised for only revealing a summary of the advice - rather than the full advice which was given to Cabinet.
This morning the house will convene to hold a vote by MPs on a censure motion over the Government's refusal to publish the full legal guidance on the Brexit deal.
Some MPs believe Mr Cox should be suspended, including Lib Dem Brexit spokesman Tom Brake. Read More Geoffrey Cox - The reason why everyone is talking about this Devon MP
Mr Brake told BBC Radio 4's Today that the deal was "the single biggest decision the country will have taken in 50 years" and the Government's decision "impedes the house in the performance of its function".
He said: "Clearly the Attorney General is the one who came to present the government's case for not releasing this and I suppose he is in line for being in contempt, and I think the house should consider suspending him for that action."
